content:
That's wonderful! Inheriting family heirlooms and antiques can be a bittersweet experience, but it's great that you're taking the time to appreciate and care for these pieces. It's even more special that you're considering preserving them for future generations.

Splitting the pieces among family members is a great way to keep the memories and stories attached to each item alive. It's also a thoughtful way to ensure that each person has a tangible connection to their heritage.

If you don't mind me asking, what kind of antique pieces did you inherit? Were there any surprises or discoveries among the items?

Also, have you considered documenting the history and provenance of each piece? This can be a fascinating process, and it can help you learn more about your family's history and the stories behind each item. It's a great way to preserve the legacy of your grandmother's estate and keep the memories alive for years to come.
